title: AMT Coffee
text:
AMT Coffee was founded in 1993 by Alistair McCallum-Toppin and his two brothers Angus and Allan. AMT Coffee is a chain of <a href="Coffeehouse">coffeehouses</a> that are located in airports, hospitals and <a href="Railway%20station">railway stations</a>.<a href="AMT%20Coffee%23cite%20note-2">[1</a>] 
AMT Coffee was the first national coffee company in the UK to use 100% bio-compostable cups and lids, 100% <a href="fairtrade">fairtrade</a> coffee and 100% organic milk, as well as the first to be accredited with the Fair Tax Mark.<a href="AMT%20Coffee%23cite%20note-AMTC%20Home-5">[2</a>] In March 2011, Ethical Consumer named it the most ethical coffee chain.<a href="AMT%20Coffee%23cite%20note-sb-4">[3</a>] 
Locations.
AMT Coffee has over 50 coffee bars across the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> and <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>.
